summary: Dr. Eyako Wurapa was charged with unprofessional conduct, incompetence, habitual intoxication, and practicing medicine while under the influence of alcohol, including an incident where he was found to have a high BAC while on duty and provided substandard patient care. He also made false statements on his license renewal application regarding disciplinary termination. The Maryland State Board of Physicians reprimanded Dr. Wurapa, suspended his license for a minimum of one year, and mandated his enrollment in the Maryland Physician Rehabilitation Program, followed by 18 months of probation.
